title: "Rammus needs too much work for a class update"
body: \*gets changes to his entire kit the patch immediately after*

replies.body:
Well, these changes are probably meant to be some "in the meantime" love for Rammus till his inevitable VGU. Not meant to fully address his issues, but put him in a "better" spot till it's his turn.

He still needs work.

That's our thinking here yeah. If we were putting a class update's worth of time into Rammus it'd be a much larger investment than this, we still wouldn't be able to address enough of his issues to get him out of someday VGU territory though.
Just as a recap for ~~me~~ people who don't know, what are Rammus issues gameplay wise?

A bit too binary.

He was originally designed as an Anti-Ad

I.E. if the opposing team had 5 ads it was INSTA win.

However with the changes to armor pen/lethality that is no longer the case, and his kit is outdated and no longer fits in the the meta.

Simply put.

Could we get a rundown of what these are supposed to _do_, though?

Because from what I've seen of them they actually look like nerfs to everything _except_ his cooldowns. The 60% self slow on W is particularly egregious.

Ummmmmmmm

Have you seen his W changes? 20 + 70% Armor and MR? With 140 total Armor/MR he will get more bonus from the ability than his live W gives him. 300 Armor/MR just about gets him double the bonus from W. Plus, it's cooldown got drastically lowered. 

Have you seen his Q changes? It went from 155% movespeed at all ranks to 150% - 235% movespeed based on level.

Have you seen his R changes? The damage to champions went down, yes, but he now slows anyone in the field and his damage to structures is actually higher than before, due to the x2 structure multiplier.

Most of his changes are pretty significant buffs.

Ooooh, R does more structure damage after getting its **actual** damage nerfed. I'm sure that will compensate for _everything._

Q's movespeed boost is worthless because movement speed has both soft and hard caps. What _is_ worth something is the fact that it lost a second of duration at all levels, meaning Rammus has less time to get around, covers less space, and _also_ deals less damage!

When the fuck does Rammus realistically get to 140 Armor/MR? 1 item sure as hell isn't enough to do it. 2 items might get him there for Armor. Oooh, but wait, MR is a shit stat they're planning on shitting on anyway, so he'd have to build 2 MR items just to get to 140 MR. And on a jungler's budget, too. ~~What are you, retarded?~~ Sure sounds like a buff to me!

At level 9, if you level W first, Rammus has ~62 base armor. Including extra armor from runes and masteries, he only needs one item to hit 140. Yes, MR will take longer to get that (as a side note, MR is getting buffs in this update - there is more of it available, and crap items (Banshee's Veil) are actually becoming useful (Abyssal Scepter gives MR _and_ increases you and your allies' magic damage?!?!)), but tanks who can defend against any damage type just by virtue of their kit are generally unhealthy. 

With these changes, Rammus can get massive amounts of Armor and MR, but he can't just immediately become unkillable to both physical _and_ magic damage - he has to choose which one he needs to defend against first. All this does is shift his power from midgame to late game, and gives him even more power there.

>Q's movespeed boost is worthless because movement speed has both soft and hard caps. What is worth something is the fact that it lost a second of duration at all levels, meaning Rammus has less time to get around, covers less space, and also deals less damage!

No, there is no hard cap for movement speed. There is a soft cap, yes, but that begins at 415 movement speed, so his current Q is affected by the cap just as much. With the soft cap (no boots or speed modifiers) Rammus' current Q maxes at 490 movement speed. However, at level 18, the new Q will max at 623 movement speed. At level 9, the new Q will max at 548 movement speed. Because of the acceleration, he will go farther with the new Q once midgame hits, even though it is 1 second shorter.

>Ooooh, R does more structure damage after getting its actual damage nerfed. I'm sure that will compensate for everything.

One of the biggest issues with tanks recently has been how much reliable damage they can do. The midseason update, and these Rammus changes to an extent, are trying to change that. Rammus is getting better tanking potential and increased utility in exchange for damage. He's a tank. He isn't supposed to go around murdering everyone. 

Not to mention, objectives are the main goal in League - you're supposed to destroy towers and, eventually, the Nexus. Bonus damage to structures is a big deal.

> Ummmmmmmm

> Have you seen his W changes? 20 + 70% Armor and MR? With 140 total Armor/MR he will get more bonus from the ability than his live W gives him. 300 Armor/MR just about gets him double the bonus from W. Plus, it's cooldown got drastically lowered. 

Yeah, it's worse early and better late. Also the damage from the thorns has been nerfed quite a bit - he would need 700 armor at lv 18 to equal the live damage at skill rank 5, lv 11. Also he slows himself now while using it.

> Have you seen his Q changes? It went from 155% movespeed at all ranks to 150% - 235% movespeed based on level.

Q is an interruptible channel now, and got a 40% damage nerf, as well as a halved slow duration.
 
> Have you seen his R changes? The damage to champions went down, yes, but he now slows anyone in the field and his damage to structures is actually higher than before, due to the x2 structure multiplier.

But the damage to champions isn't just down, it's WAY WAY down. Down by over a third. That is not something to just dismiss, given it's his Ultimate.

> Most of his changes are pretty significant buffs.

Except the parts which are pretty significant nerfs, the main problem being that he won't deal anywhere near enough damage.

>Yeah, it's worse early and better late. Also the damage from the thorns has been nerfed quite a bit - he would need 700 armor at lv 18 to equal the live damage at skill rank 5, lv 11. Also he slows himself now while using it.

The thorns damage is equal at 300 armor (current: W gives 120 additional armor for 420 total, Damage = 65 + 42 (10%) = 107 damage; new: W gives 230 additional armor for 530 total, Damage (lvl 18) = 20 + 53 (10%) = 73 x 1.5 = 109.5 damage). His passive deals 150% damage during W. I do agree that the slow is probably too high, and should at least be lowered to maybe 20-30%, if they _have_ to keep it.

>Q is an interruptible channel now, and got a 40% damage nerf, as well as a halved slow duration.

The slow amount was also doubled, and its hitbox and collision detection were cleaned up.

>But the damage to champions isn't just down, it's WAY WAY down. Down by over a third. That is not something to just dismiss, given it's his Ultimate.

And he also gets a stacking slow on his ult, up to 64/80/96%, which is nothing to dismiss, either.

>Except the parts which are pretty significant nerfs, the main problem being that he won't deal anywhere near enough damage.

He is losing upfront damage for more utility and pretty significantly higher tanking potential late game. There are tanks like Sejuani and Sion that are meant to be able to deal massive damage in certain situations, but Rammus is really meant to be a more tanky tank. 

There are issues - the 60% self slow seems _way_ too high, especially after trying it on PBE, and the attack speed buff during his taunt seems... out of place. I'm not really sure why he wants an attack speed boost, especially when his W will slow him too much to make use of it after the taunt has ended. The lowered Q, passive, and thorns damage in the early game is also a bit worrying for his early clears, but they can probably fix that with a "X% bonus damage to monsters" on his passive if it's an issue.

Ah yes, I forgot to factor the extra armor into his damage. Still, he slows himself, which makes the ability bad (self CC is always bad).

> The slow amount was also doubled, and its hitbox and collision detection were cleaned up.

A double slow value is never worth a halved duration.

> And he also gets a stacking slow on his ult, up to 64/80/96%, which is nothing to dismiss, either.

The ult is not going to stack, because everyone has access to a million leaps, dashes, flashes, and if they stand in it, it's only going to tickle now.

> He is losing upfront damage for more utility and pretty significantly higher tanking potential late game. There are tanks like Sejuani and Sion that are meant to be able to deal massive damage in certain situations, but Rammus is really meant to be a more tanky tank. 

Rammus is not supposed to be just "a tanky tank" he's supposed to be "hey guys, come kill yourselves". He needs to be able to 1v5 the enemy team, because that's what's fun. He's losing utility (lower slow duration on Q, self slowing), gaining less attack damage (because he just gets less damage off of his passive), losing ult damage AND Q damage just to get a slow on his ultimate - that's garbage.

As a melee champion, losing damage is NEVER worth it, unless you're becoming 100% unkiteable and I'm highly skeptical if this Rammus could even 1v1 carries.

For me, the big problem with rammus is that Malphite exists and brings more utility as a tank than he does. Although his current-patch kit as a few niche options (the ability to chase enemies down lane and the ability to get a surprisingly scary attack stat through armor hoarding), malph doesn't actually get punished that hard for building an MR item compared to rammus (as AP on malph is never a bad thing while asking rammus to build a spirit visage is like putting bicycle tires on a hummer). For a potential rework, I'm thinking they could expand on the whole "resistances=offensive stats" thing, or more accurately make his passive be that he not only gains attack from armor (would be reduced to accomidate the next thing) but also give him AP from MR stacking. Then hybrid builds could potentially be a thing, and if done right he could go back to being that incredibly annoying sandshrew that people have been waiting for for years.
